content:
I've edited the wording and format of Input section.

I've also changed "speedMultiplier" to "speed" in Constraints section and stub generator for consistency with other sections.

The Example in the statement is incorrect, the inputs should be 1.0 and 0.98... it seems like you might have edited the clash without changing the statement, but it's very confusing in-clash. I'm going to edit it now, but this was the statement text:

Input:
2
5.0
4.9

Output:
DEAD 0.14

There are 2 zombies traveling at 1.0 and 0.98 tiles / second respectively.
After 7 seconds the 1st zombie will be on the 2nd tile, and the squash will kill both, the distance between the nearest and furthest 0.14 tiles
This contribution hasn’t received enough positive votes from the community. The "FASTEST" option has therefore been deactivated.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I love Plants vs zombies

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: good thing mate

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very interesting problem. Took me 8 minutes in C but that's just because I'm bad and didn't read some of it lol
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!
nice clash, nothing wrong it seems like, apart from the fact you only use 1 squash to defend against a whole mob of zombies.

Thank you!
You gave me an idea of a challenge.
I'm goiny to developet this algorithm

Input section
* Please mention the variable types (integer, float) for both line descriptions.
* Please add the variable name in the description to "Next N lines", as it is otherwise not defined anywhere but stated in the Constraints section.
* The variable name should be consistent throughout. [[speedMultiplier]] is used in the stub generator. Please use either that or [[multiplier]] in all the sections.
* As mentioned by Rafarafa, please move the example with its explanation to the Goal section.

Output section
* ALIVE and DEAD are constants instead of variables. Please format the words using the syntax {{ }} instead, e.g. {{ALIVE}}.
* Please mention that the word and the number/distance should be space-separated.

Cases
* Some cases violate the multiplier constraint as the multipliers in those cases ≥ 5.0. Please fix the cases or the constraint.

Thanks.

Nice one!, I'd probably change:

* 1x1 area - > 9x1 area (or grid)
* Once any zombie is within 1 tile (2nd tile or less), the squash will activate. -> (add after) The squash will only activate once per game (I knew that because I've played the game but I could see it being confusing for someone that hasn't)
* The squash will kill every zombie in a range of 1 from the landing point.
* Put the example in the statement instead of the input section.
thanks ill make the changes
thanks ill make the changes
good luck
nice
aaaaaaaaaaa i panik when i saw 69420 zombies coming to my house!
ok bomber

Also, it doesn't really make sense to me how this works based on the gif and the statement.

If the squash is on the 1st tile and squashes a 1x1 area, then it should only kill zombies that make it to the 1st tile. In the example, the lead zombie is on the 2nd tile and the other zombie is 0.14 tiles behind that. Neither are on the 1st tile, so why do they die?

In truth, any zombie that is <= 2 tiles away will be killed, according to the tests and solution. So it seems like the squash kills all the zombies on tiles 1 or 2 (1x2 area). It would be good to make all of this clear in the statement, because currently it doesn't explain it well and clashers have to solve the problem based on the tests instead of the statement.

I think the initial location of the squash is irrelevant. I'll interpret the rules based on the author's solution as follows:

When the frontmost zombie gets within the first two tiles, the squash activates, and destroys all zombies that are within 1 tile behind the frontmost zombie at that moment.

Even the description of "1x2 area" like you suggested could be confusing. In the example you put in the statement, the zombie at the back is on tile 2.14, and that's even wider than a "1x2 area".

Nice, yeah your wording makes way more sense. That would help a lot in the statement, and perhaps removing any mention of the squashing location. Even the gif. Because the gif makes it look like the squash doesn't move and activates when someone enters the start of its range, whereas the solution is more like it immediately activates when a zombie is on the end of its range.

OK, I've rewritten the explanation in Goal section. The original text is quoted below for reference.

*****

The squash in Plants vs Zombies squashes zombies in a 1x1 area {{https://giphy.com/gifs/PNutZn2nNItKPjqULZ}} (gif of squash)
A squash is placed on the {{1st tile}}, and there are {{9}} tiles in total (1x9 grid).
Once the distance between any zombie and the squash is less or equal to 1 tile <<(any zombie has walked 7 or more tiles)>>, the squash will activate.
A zombie will walk at [[speed]] tiles / second.

<<Note:>>
- All zombies will be spawned on the 9th tile at the same time
- Zombie positions are updated <<ONCE per second>>
- The squash will only activate <<ONCE per game>> then it will die along with the zombies it squashes

*****
In case you have missed it, Validator 2 still violates the second constraint :wink:
